image.altText: Chelsey Potter is wearing a white collared shirt and smiling

props.synopsis: Once a prospective SA Liberal candidate, Chelsey Potter says she feels disillusioned and "politically homeless" - and she's not alone.

title.children: Former SA Liberal staffer says she couldn't vote for Dutton-led party

image.altText: Tammy Franks in front of microphones with her arms out

props.synopsis: The now-former South Australian's Greens co-leader Tammy Franks quit the party this week and didn't go quietly. But what happens now for the party?

title.children: 'It's not easy being green': Kermit's famous line resonates for Greens

image.altText: A woman with black hair stands by the Murray River holding a diary that was returned to her

props.synopsis: A diary dating back to pre-World War I that was left on the doorstep of an RSL club in Adelaide has been united with the descendants of its writer.

title.children: Mysterious 121yo diary returned to its roots

image.altText: Man in cap with sunglasses and a white moustache and blue checkered shirt with dark trousers stands in outback station

props.synopsis: Pastoralists in the far west of NSW are trialling new ways to manage arid landscapes by re-introducing native seeds to make the environment more rain-ready.

title.children: Farmers 'already pleased' with arid land rehabilitated with native seeds

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain will drench Australia's east coast next week, but there will be no relief for drought-ravaged South Australia, Victoria and south-west New South Wales.

title.children: First taste of winter with upcoming temperature drop after warm autumn

image.altText: a man in a blue formal shirt sitting at a park bench with a body of water behind him

props.synopsis: Riverland resident Mike Fuller is pleased to see government agencies have admitted some faults, particularly in sourcing local knowledge, when managing major River Murray flooding.

title.children: Flooded residents welcome call to be included should another disaster strike

image.altText: Luke Beveridge scratches his head

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge warns Port Adelaide chair David Koch of retribution over a claim Willie Rioli was sledged by his players.

title.children: Beveridge fires back at claims Bulldogs provoked Power's Rioli

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: bara bara

props.synopsis: After two rounds of semis, 26 countries are facing off in Basel, Switzerland to be crowned the winner of Eurovision 2025.

title.children: Countdown to Eurovision winner as votes tallied in grand final

image.altText: A middleaged man in a blue shirt, which has the logo blurred, stands outside a family home on a grass strip.

props.synopsis: Multiple witnesses giving evidence at the coronial inquest into the April 2024 stabbing rampage have stressed the "benefit of hindsight" in revisiting their interactions with Joel Cauchi.

title.children: 'Did the best I could': Witnesses defend actions amid Bondi stabbing inquest

image.altText: Teacher points at ipad with three highschool students in class, smiling and looking at content online.

props.synopsis: The governor-general says misinformation is the scourge of our times — and Australia's future is at stake.

title.children: Schools to adopt media literacy course in wake of crushing civics results

image.altText: A drawing of Sean Combs, wearing a pale blue jumper, making a heart sign with his hands while standing in court.

props.synopsis: Disgraced hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs always knew how to attract attention but he probably never anticipated the circus that now surrounds him at his criminal trial.

title.children: Giggles, scuffles and trial by TikTok: The Diddy courtroom circus

image.altText: A boy in a red shirt sits in front of a building razed to the ground

props.synopsis: Israeli forces ramp up a bombing campaign that has killed hundreds of people over 72 hours, amid ceasefire talks with Hamas.

title.children: Israel launches expanded offensive in Gaza amid ceasefire talks

image.altText: Conclave elects the new pope, at the Vatican

props.synopsis: The contrast of Pope Leo and Donald Trump goes far beyond Christendom or American economic power; it goes to what we want from our leaders, who we will follow, who we will heed, and where our future lies.

title.children: The pickle of 'woke' Pope Leo for MAGA Catholics

image.altText: A man in white and a man in blue in front of a production line.

props.synopsis: Manufacturers in China race to fulfil US orders as the reciprocal tariff pause takes effect, but the renewed trade war has already caused some businesses to take drastic measures.

title.children: What Chinese factories and businesses think about the US tariff pause

image.altText: A black and silver Visa bank card seen placed on a blurred background of another turquoise bank card

props.synopsis: Visa and Mastercard want to give artificial intelligence bots more control of Australians' bank cards, in a technological advancement they say could "revolutionise" shopping.

title.children: How AI could soon be built into your bank card — and spend your money

image.altText: A two-storey brick house is left exposed with its back wall torn off

props.synopsis: Storm systems sweeping across the US leave at least 23 people dead, including 14 people killed after a tornado in south-eastern Kentucky.

title.children: Deadly tornado and severe storms sweep across US

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Each week, I optimistically roll out another Hard Quiz for your Sunday morning entertainment. Surely you can repay the favour by improving every now and then?

title.children: One of these days you might blitz Hard Quiz. I don't think today will be that day

image.altText: A man outside court.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man wrongfully convicted of the notorious murders of two police officers — for which he last month secured a multi-million-dollar settlement — is now being sued over his role in an armed robbery.

title.children: Jason Roberts faces robbery lawsuit weeks after settling wrongful conviction

image.altText: Flavio Briatore leaning over the pit wall, through a gap in the fencing, before an F1 race

props.synopsis: In the wild, wonderful and unpredictable world of Formula 1 racing, Alpine stand alone as the undisputed leader in chaos.

title.children: The sacked Aussie, the Italian fugitive and an F1 giant's Hail Mary

image.altText: Adam Selwood as assistant coach of West Coast AFLW looks on during a training session

props.synopsis: Former West Coast Eagles premiership player Adam Selwood dies just months after the death of his twin brother, former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood.

title.children: Former West Coast premiership player Adam Selwood dies at 41

image.altText: Oscar Piastri gives the thumbs up after qualifying at Imola F1 Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: F1 championship leader Oscar Piastri keeps calm under pressure to put McLaren on pole position for the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri maintains his cool to take pole ahead of Verstappen at Imola

image.altText: Crystal Palace celebrates winning FA Cup.

props.synopsis: Crystal Palace stuns Manchester City 1-0 in the FA Cup final to win the first major trophy of its 164-year history, thanks to a goal from local hero Eberechi Eze.

title.children: Crystal Palace seals historic FA Cup final win against Man City

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing development with a green arrow pointing downwards next to a percentage sign

props.synopsis: The Board of the Reserve Bank of Australia will be meeting on Monday and Tuesday, with economists expecting a cut to the cash rate target.

title.children: Hoping for an interest rate cut? Here's when it may happen

image.altText: Stanton concentrating as she runs.

props.synopsis: Incontinence is tricky to talk about, it's even harder to run with. Former Olympian Krishna Stanton had to give up her passion because of it, but now she's back and breaking records.

title.children: Incontinence can be debilitating. It pushed a former Olympian to her limits

image.altText: Discarded piles of waste coal rise up from the flat, barren landscape outside a Central Queensland mining town

props.synopsis: The pioneers who helped build Queensland's mining towns in the 1960s and 70s are reaching retirement, but aged care services remain thin on the ground.

title.children: Aging residents who established mining towns struggle to stay

image.altText: The fierce face of an Australian bull ant.

props.synopsis: Australia's native ants do an incredible amount of environmental and agricultural heavy lifting. Here are 10 of our mighty little workers.

title.children: There are trillions of them, and they're hard at work across Australia

image.altText: New Scotland Yard police headquarters in London, January 27, 2011.

props.synopsis: A court is told the three men had allegedly targeted Britain-based journalists connected with a broadcaster critical of the Iranian government.

title.children: Three alleged Iranian spies charged with targeting UK journalists

image.altText: A boy chases after a maroon ball in Government House as people watch on.

props.synopsis: A maroon footy kicked around Government House is one way to announce Queensland's presence in Canberra, writes Claudia Williams.

title.children: Queensland still making its mark in Canberra despite Dutton's exit

image.altText: Melbourne Metro city loop train

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will make public transport free for all children from next year in a bid to relieve cost-of-living pressures.

title.children: Victoria to offer free public transport for children from next year

image.altText: The crumpled remains of a blue passenger van with its front window blown out and side door destroyed

props.synopsis: The bus, which was travelling towards Ukraine's north-eastern city of Sumy, was "targeted by the Russians", according to the local military administration.

title.children: Ukraine accuses Russia of deadly bus strike hours after peace talks

image.altText: A photo of grey seashells aligned to spell out 8-6-4-7 on the sand of a beach

props.synopsis: A photo of seashells posted to former FBI director James Comey's Instagram account has sparked controversy in the US, with some saying it is a call for violence against President Donald Trump.

title.children: Secret Service investigates former FBI director over seashells photo

image.altText: An emotional Collingwood AFL coach Craig McRae wipes his face as he stands on the MCG after a game.

props.synopsis: Collingwood coach Craig McRae is brought to tears on multiple occasions when discussing the tragic death of Adam Selwood as the Dockers, Cats and Bulldogs record impressive wins.

title.children: 'No book written on this': McRae breaks down discussing tragic Selwood death

image.altText: Melbourne Storm winger Xavier Coates jumps over Daniel Atkinson to score a try against the Sharks.

props.synopsis: Melbourne winger Xavier Coates takes a spectacular grab to complete his hat-trick as the Storm falls just short of a comeback against the Sharks in Cronulla. Follow live.

title.children: Coates lauded as 'a freak' yet again for latest miracle try in Storm loss

image.altText: Man with hands on hips

props.synopsis: An inquiry into a series of landslides on the Mornington Peninsula, just outside Melbourne has heard multiple theories as to what caused them. Several theories involve water damage throughout the hillside neighbourhood.

title.children: The collapse of a multi-million-dollar home shocked many. But clues may have bubbled up for weeks
